bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 21, [1896]

div1.p: Lazear writes that he plans to spend time at home, although he will have to make regular trips to the laboratory.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 21, [1896]
div1.p:
Two letters
came from you since
I wrote a week ago
and I have been
intending to answer
before this.

It has been warm
here for a few days.

I am going out to
Windsor about
Wednesday and I shall
stay there probably for
a couple of weeks,
coming in every day
to the laboratory.
There is a piece of
work I am anxious
to do, and it can
be done better now
than next fall

I will call for
my letters here every
day.

I sent the wedding
presents to San Francisco as they
preferred it so. They arrived all
right and seem to have pleased
them very much.
It is still very comfortable here.

I do not pretend to do very much
work. The early summer is
not bad at all.

I hope you are getting enough
to eat eat Be sure and
take plenty of exercise
